newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila stocks end lower, despite rebound.
newsitem.headline: Manila stocks end lower, despite rebound.

text.p: * PLDT, San Miguel bounce back in midsession
Manila shares ended slightly lower on Monday despite a rebound towards the end of the session after an initial spasm of profit-taking, brokers said.
"It was just profit-taking but some of the players decided to buy back in late trade," said Jonas Ferrer, research director at Pryce Securities Inc.
The main index shed 7.39 points to close at 3,092.34 points, off the intra-day low of 3,062.11.
Blue chips PLDT and San Miguel Corp which fell in early trade ended up pulling the index to higher ground, traders added.
"Overall, you see the underlying strength of the market because after reaching a low of 3,060 points, it rebounded," said Ferrer.
The market is expected to drift sideways with an upward bias for the rest of the week, said Julie Villena, trader at Dharmala Securities (Phils) Inc.
She added the index will move within the 3,150 to 3,200 range. -KATHERINE ESPINA (63) 2 841-8937 Fax 8176267
